Class GenericRequester

  • java.lang.Object

    public class GenericRequester
extends java.lang.Object
implements Requester
    GenericRequester implements the API of Requester for various Persisters.

    • Method Detail

      • getResponse

        public int getResponse(java.lang.String request,
                       java.lang.StringBuffer strBuf,
                       boolean autoDisconn)
                throws WrapperException
        This takes either an ad hoc message body or a generic query command as a request. First it converts the request into a JMS message. It sends the request message to the destination and returns the number of items filled in the given string buffer. The content in the string buffer is a JSON. If the disconnect flag is set to true, it disconnects right before it returns. Otherwise, it will keep the connection alive.

        By default, the request is not assumed to be a query command. If RequestCommand is defined, the request is assumed as a query command. A query command is supposed to be as follows:
        ACTION Target Attributes

        In case of a fatal failure, it disconnects first and then throws a WrapperException with cause set to the vendor specific exception or IO related exception. Therefore please make sure to get the cause exception from it and handles the cause exception with care. For other failures, it throws an IllegalArgumentException. If the disconnect flag is set to true, it disconnects right before it throws the exception.
        Specified by:
        getResponse in interface Requester
        Throws:
        WrapperException
